Frank, I was thinking that we could actually create a separate git repository and not just a project under commons. Basically developers would get that repository first and then bootstrap based on it. The repository would also host the commons settings files (as you already proposed in the code review).
The developer repository would be different from the releng repository. The former would be useful for anyone working on the code base while the latter is only relevant for build/release engineers. I think that split is particularly helpful for contributors who get easily confused by the number of target files etc. that are mostly relevant for the build only.
Sam, Tomek, any thoughts on that?

It makes sense to me to collect things like development targets and launch configs somewhere, but I'm not sure whether it's worth having a separate repository. What are the advantages over just having a project in commons?
Aren't the code formatter settings (step 12) part of the project configuration, so users shouldn't need to set them globally?
You are right, we do have a lot of repositories already so it makes sense to keep it in commons.

(In reply to Sam Davis from comment #4) > It makes sense to me to collect things like development targets and launch > configs somewhere, but I'm not sure whether it's worth having a separate > repository. What are the advantages over just having a project in commons? > > Aren't the code formatter settings (step 12) part of the project > configuration, so users shouldn't need to set them globally?
Thanks!
Step 12 is not necessary so I remove it.
(In reply to Steffen Pingel from comment #5) > You are right, we do have a lot of repositories already so it makes sense to > keep it in commons.
If we use the common repository we have all targest ans launch definition in both workspaces.
If we use a new repository we can only import the needed folder into the bootstrap or work workspace. But then you must remember to refresh the repository to fetch new versions of the files.

Thanks Frank. I have a couple of comments.
Why is this only for Luna and newer? It looks to me like this should all work on older versions too.
I wonder if we should direct people to use the Gerrit connector for cloning so that they don't have to manually enter URLs.

(In reply to Sam Davis from comment #10) > Thanks Frank. I have a couple of comments. > > Why is this only for Luna and newer? It looks to me like this should all > work on older versions too.
OK we can do this, but the we need extra target definition for every version Should we add mylyn-bootstrap-e4.3.target and mylyn-work-e4.3.target? > > I wonder if we should direct people to use the Gerrit connector for cloning > so that they don't have to manually enter URLs.
Sorry I did not know this! Is this a new feature? How can I do this?

(In reply to comment #11) > (In reply to Sam Davis from comment #10) > > Thanks Frank. I have a couple of comments. > > > > Why is this only for Luna and newer? It looks to me like this should all > > work on older versions too. > > OK we can do this, but the we need extra target definition for every version > Should we add mylyn-bootstrap-e4.3.target and mylyn-work-e4.3.target?
I don't see any benefit in that. I think it makes sense to encourage bootstrapping on the latest. I would prefer to not add anymore overhead for maintaing the bootstrap setup.
> > I wonder if we should direct people to use the Gerrit connector for cloning > > so that they don't have to manually enter URLs. > > Sorry I did not know this! > Is this a new feature? > How can I do this?
File > Import > Projects from Git. You need to have the Mylyn Gerrit connector and the Eclipse.org server configured.

The Gerrit connector makes it really easy to clone the git repositories and get set up to push to gerrit. Unfortunately we don't have clear instructions on how to do that (we still tell people to Add Gerrit as a Git Remote). We also don't have instructions on generating SSH keys for Gerrit. Multiple potential contributors have found it very difficult to get set up to push to Gerrit.
I would like to address the above issues with the contributor reference when I get a chance.
